notes: invariable masculine noun; greeting formula; often written as two words "buona sera"; commonly used standalone without article
used with article in phrases like "Un buonasera a tutti!"; masculine invariable
rare with article; masculine invariable greeting
example_sentence_italian: Il buonasera del presentatore è stato caloroso.
example_sentence_english: The good evening from the host was warm.

example_sentence_italian: I buonasera arrivavano da ogni parte.
example_sentence_english: The good evenings were coming from everywhere.

example_sentence_italian: Si sentivano dei buonasera nel corridoio.
example_sentence_english: Some good evenings were heard in the hallway.

example_sentence_italian: Il tono del buonasera era cordiale.
example_sentence_english: The tone of the good evening was friendly.

example_sentence_italian: Rispondemmo al buonasera con un sorriso.
example_sentence_english: We replied to the good evening with a smile.

example_sentence_italian: Ho risposto ai buonasera dei vicini.
example_sentence_english: I replied to the neighbors' good evenings.

example_sentence_italian: Siamo stati accolti dal buonasera del portiere.
example_sentence_english: We were welcomed by the doorman's good evening.
We were distracted by the good evenings.

example_sentence_italian: C'è calore nel buonasera di Maria.
example_sentence_english: There is warmth in Maria's good evening.
We got lost in the repeated good evenings.
They joked about the initial good evening.
They laughed about the overly formal good evenings.

example_sentence_italian: Ha esordito col buonasera di rito.
example_sentence_english: He started with the customary good evening.
